thread.title: Google Users Unexpectedly Signed Out of Accounts | News & Opinion | PCMag.com
thread.title_full: Google Users Unexpectedly Signed Out of Accounts | News & Opinion | PCMag.com

author: Angela Moscaritolo
title: Google Users Unexpectedly Signed Out of Accounts | News & Opinion | PCMag.com
text:
Did you get logged out of your Google accounts last night? You're not alone.
Google received reports of users being unexpectedly signed out of their email accounts Thursday night, Google Community Manager Crystal Cee said on the Gmail Help Forum . Posts from affected users on Twitter indicate that the problem extended to other Google services, like YouTube, too.
@gmail @google Was randomly logged out from my account on multiple apps??? Can't log back in or else I receive this message pic.twitter.com/899V1WrRt1 
â€” Jo?? (@lilgreenahgase) February 24, 2017 The problem also appears to have affected Google Wifi and OnHub devices. In a support note, Google said an issue with its Google Accounts engine caused some devices to automatically revert to factory settings.
"Unfortunately, these devices need to be set up again," Google wrote. "We'd like to share our sincerest apologies for the inconvenience." For instructions on re-setting up your Wifi points, head here .
